posts._title: Leigh Jason – The Bride Walks Out (1936)
posts.title: The Bride Walks Out
posts.excerpt: A model marries a struggling engineer; but he won’t let her keep her job, and they can’t pay the bills, while she is wooed by a wealthy drinker.Michael Martin (Gene Raymond) tells Paul Dodson (Ned Sparks) he knows of a better job, and they get fired. Michael asks modeling Carolyn (Barbara Stanwyck) to marry, but …

posts.title: Undine
posts.excerpt: Undine works as a historian lecturing on Berlin’s urban development. But when the man she loves leaves her, the ancient myth catches up with her. Undine has to kill the man who betrays her and return to the water.

posts._title: Josef von Sternberg – The Saga of Anatahan [1958 version] (1953)
posts.title: The Saga of Anatahan [1958 version]
posts.excerpt: Quote:In June 1944, twelve Japanese seaman are stranded on an abandoned-and-forgotten island called An-ta-han for seven years. The island’s only inhabitants are the overseer of the abandoned plantation and an attractive young Japanese woman. Discipline is represented by a former warrant officer but ends when he suffers a loss-of-face catastrophe. Soon, discipline and rationality are …

posts._title: Fernando Cortizo – O Apóstolo AKA The Apostle (2012)
posts.title: O Apóstolo
posts.excerpt: Quote:An escaped prison convict attempts to retrieve a loot hidden years ago in a lonely village. Sinister elders, strange disappearances, spirits, a peculiar priest and even the Archpriest of Santiago will cross their paths in a history of horror.

posts._title: Robert Day – Ritual of Evil [+ commentary] (1970)
posts.title: Ritual of Evil [+ commentary]
posts.excerpt: Dr. David Sorell (Jourdan) investigates the death of one of his patients, a young heiress, and uncovers a cult of wealthy people who practice black magic, witchcraft and devil worship. Hyde-White returns as Harry Snowden, one of David’s associates.

posts._title: Joe D’Amato – L’alcova AKA The Alcove (1985)
posts.title: L’alcova
posts.excerpt: An English soldier returns home from the Zulu war with the daughter of a tribal king as his slave (a gift that he was given for “saving” the kings life). While he was away, his wife had been having an affair with the female housekeeper. Not at all pleased with being a slave, the Ebony …

posts._title: Allen Reisner – All Mine to Give (1957)
posts.title: All Mine to Give
posts.excerpt: This is a story based on fact that follows a husband and wife who emigrate from Scotland to Wisconsin in the 1850’s. They work very hard and become welcome citizens of their new town, Eureka. They have six children. They prosper in the husband’s boat building business. But when their eldest is 12, tragedy strikes …

posts.title: Gallant Sons
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: from TCM Johnny Davis, the son of gambler “Natural” Davis, Byron “By” Newbold, the son of crusading newspaper editor Barton Newbold, and Kate Pendleton, the daughter of Clare Pendleton, a wealthy widow and sportswoman, are schoolmates. Barton Newbold, who is determined to publicize Natural’s illicit activities, organizes a raid on Natural’s casino, which Natural …

posts._title: Various – Les Films des maisons closes AKA The Films from Brothels (1925 – 1945)
posts.title: Les Films des maisons closes
posts.excerpt: The invention of censorship, which dates a few years later than the invention of cinema, pushed smutty films to go underground which is synonymous with total freedom, since banned, erotic films could become fully pornographic. Banned but still produced, filmed and especially shown, these films are called “from brothels”, as some were shown in smoking …

posts._title: Nagisa Oshima – Shinjuku dorobo nikki AKA Diary of a Shinjuku Thief (1968)
posts.title: Shinjuku dorobo nikki
posts.excerpt: When a thief is caught stealing form a book shop by one of its employees, the two embark on an unusual, erotic adventure.
